meanings.definition: To purchase more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys outbuying her friends when they go shopping together.
meanings.sent2: He is always outbuying his siblings when it comes to video games.
meanings.sent3: The competition for outbuying the most snacks at the party was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outbuy all her competitors in the auction was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: Outbuying the latest gadgets has become his favorite hobby.

meanings.definition: The act of buying more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outbuying of clothes is well-known among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was attributed to their outbuying of competitors.
meanings.sent3: The outbuying of popcorn at the movie theater led to a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His outbuying of rare books was like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent5: The outbuying of tickets for the concert caused a frenzy among fans.
